main event: An unidentified flying object was observed as a white sphere blending into reddish tones, moving in an arc over Great Kills, New York on 14 June 1954.
interesting points: The observation lasted for only 2-3 seconds., The object's flight path included a shallow upward movement followed by descent., The observer described the object as being round and approximately the size of a ball held 15-20 feet away., After it vanished, the western sky lit up as if by 'heat lightning'., The witness reported hearing a sound of what might have been an aircraft immediately after the object vanished.
sighted object: a single white sphere blending into reddish tones
witness description: A 29-year-old employed as a telephone switchman
